title: Jõuluküla “Jõulud kirjasõnaga” – Day 1
description: Living-history style Christmas Village across historic farmsteads with period crafts, traditional music, and folk customs in an open-air setting.

title: Jõuluküla “Jõulud kirjasõnaga” – Day 2
description: Second festival day of the Open Air Museum’s Christmas Village: historic houses host seasonal rituals, storytelling, and heritage food stalls.

title: Kiek in de Kök & Bastion Passages (Tallinn City Museum)
description: Tower-to-tunnel fortress museum linking medieval/early-modern defensive towers with the original bastion tunnels beneath Old Town.

operatingHours.summary: Winter schedule: museum towers typically Tue–Sun ~10:00–18:00, Mon closed; Bastion Passages only by timed guided tours (reduced winter frequency—book ahead).

uniquenessReason: Only place in Tallinn where you can walk the actual bastion tunnel network under the medieval fortifications.
fitReason: Direct hit for fortress architecture, siege history, and arms displays—very close to RPG castle/stronghold exploration.

title: Niguliste Museum (St Nicholas’ Church)
description: Gothic church-museum renowned for medieval sacred art including Bernt Notke’s Danse Macabre; frequent early music performances in resonant acoustics.

operatingHours.summary: Typical winter hours Tue–Sun around 10:00–18:00; closed Mon. Evening concerts on select dates.

uniquenessReason: Houses one of Northern Europe’s pivotal late-medieval artworks inside an intact Gothic sacred space.
fitReason: Medieval art and sacred atmosphere align with the aesthetic of fantasy RPG cathedrals and lore.

title: Rakvere Castle (Rakvere Linnus) – Day Trip
description: Living‑history stronghold with smithy, armory, alchemist’s cellar, torture chamber exhibits, and seasonal demos.

operatingHours.summary: Winter hours typically around 10:00–16:00; demonstrations more frequent on weekends; check weekly schedule.

uniquenessReason: Hands‑on medieval fortress experience rare in the region, with working crafts/weaponry rooms.
fitReason: Blacksmithing, arms & armor, and role‑playable castle environments directly map to strategy/RPG tastes.
